Package: com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant

[Java] Interface VariantFactory<T>

  • Interface for Variant Factory. While VariantManager is the general variant management, implementation of this interface provides variant type (app, lib) specific implementation.

    • Methods Summary

        Methods 
        Type Name and description
        BaseVariant createVariantApi(BaseVariantData<? extends BaseVariantOutputData> variantData, ReadOnlyObjectProvider readOnlyObjectProvider)
        T createVariantData(GradleVariantConfiguration variantConfiguration, Set<String> densities, Set<String> abi, Set<String> compatibleScreens, TaskManager taskManager)
        VariantType getVariantConfigurationType()
        boolean isLibrary()
        void validateModel(VariantModel model)
        Fail if the model is configured incorrectly.

    • Method Detail

      • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public BaseVariant createVariantApi(@com.android.annotations.NonNull BaseVariantData<? extends BaseVariantOutputData> variantData, @com.android.annotations.NonNull ReadOnlyObjectProvider readOnlyObjectProvider)

      • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public T createVariantData(@com.android.annotations.NonNull GradleVariantConfiguration variantConfiguration, @com.android.annotations.NonNull Set<String> densities, @com.android.annotations.NonNull Set<String> abi, @com.android.annotations.NonNull Set<String> compatibleScreens, @com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskManager taskManager)

      • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public VariantType getVariantConfigurationType()

      • public boolean isLibrary()

      • public void validateModel(@com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantModel model)

        Fail if the model is configured incorrectly.

        throws:
        org.gradle.api.GradleException when the model does not validate.
        Parameters:
        model - the non-null model to validate, as implemented by the VariantManager.
